intro: Horkelia purpurascens, commonly known as the purple flax, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pink, with purple-tinged petals. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs, and the plant is well adapted to arid environments. Horkelia purpurascens is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
